fits.conflict-resolution: One-on-one meetings, looks for a common goal
fits.plan-process: Defining the problem and expected outcomes, design thinking processes, and presenting findings / solutions.
fits.office-layout: Cubicles and offices; product team creative-spaces (coming soon)
fits.team-building: Local fun that promotes work-life balance like bowling or a local baseball game. This company likes a strong, close team but doesn't want to take a lot of time away from their personal lives
fits.likes: 'The Open Door Policy': No one is out of reach through the corporate structure and professional titles are a means to direct information and not build boundaries.
fits.dislikes: This company is old fashion when it comes to business mentality and external meetings; numbers are important here

fits.conflict-resolution: There is reportedly little to no conflict
fits.plan-process: Strict Enterprise Project Processes, and emergency fixes require approval from a committee

fits.conflict-resolution: One-on-one meetings between managers and the people involved followed by a sit-down with all three individuals if needed.
fits.plan-process: Asurion is focused on creating experimental features and measuring the affect on their users. They believe in an ever-changing environment to focus their creative-minds. When a critical and immediate need arises, the team responsible for the task will have a time-boxed meeting to determine how they can fulfill the goal, followed by rolling out the feature out to a small subset of users. After this is complete, they evaluate its performance and decide if and how to scale it.
fits.office-layout: Open floor plan with assigned desks
fits.team-building: Asurion provides during- and after-work events such as baseball games, ultimate frisbee, trivia, board games, and more.
fits.likes: Asurion tends to invest in the growth and success of its employees with a flexible, friendly and fulfilling work environment.
fits.dislikes: It's a large company, so it's sometimes difficult to work across organizations, but we find ways to reduce dependencies as possible.
fits.hours: Flexible. Unlimited vacation policy and many work remotely.
fits.appeal: A place with solid benefits that would help me grow as a professional without the typical stressors of working for a technology company.

fits.conflict-resolution: One-on-one meetings with each individual involved to help reach a common goal.
fits.office-layout: Open floor layout with assigned desks
fits.appeal: A company that values an employees skills and time.

fits.conflict-resolution: A team meeting is scheduled where everyone talks about the issue(s) and how they'd like it resolved, and as a team a solution is developed.
fits.office-layout: A sea of cubicles and executives have their offices
fits.team-building: Bowling or a local baseball game; something local and fun that doesn't take up a ton of time.

fits.conflict-resolution: One-on-one meetings with each individual involved to help reach a common goal.
fits.office-layout: A sea of cubicles and executives have their own offices
fits.team-building: Bowling or a local baseball game; something local and fun that doesn't take up a ton of time.

fits.conflict-resolution: One-on-one meetings with each individual involved to help reach a common goal.
fits.plan-process: From engineering perspective, take requirements from product. Build an LDR (lightweight design requirements) to talk through implementation details and get buy-in from stakeholders (Crews, Architect, Leads). Once approved, the tasks are created and work is completed in sprint(s) to deliver project.
fits.office-layout: Open floor layout with assigned desks
fits.team-building: Emma will host company wide events such as a scavenger hunt, department laser tag afternoons, both during work hours. Teams will do lunches/dinners semi-frequently. We also have larger company wide events Xmas party and Talent Night (middle of the year bi-annual)
fits.likes: People focused, we tend to get treated like adults and let you get your job done.
fits.appeal: Growth opportunity, what am I likely to work on, work that is fulfilling and challenging. The companies track record with mentoring and growing talent and the temperament of previous Jrs that were successful in that culture. Some people flourish in open environments, while others do better with structure. Knowing how you work best will help you know what to look for in a company.

fits.conflict-resolution: A team meeting is scheduled where everyone talks about the issue(s) and how they'd like it resolved, and as a team a solution is developed.
fits.plan-process: It's all hands on deck.  We work together to identify the what, how and when it can be accomplished.
fits.office-layout: A sea of cubicles and executives have their own offices
fits.team-building: Bowling or a local baseball game; something local and fun that doesn't take up a ton of time.
fits.likes: Collaborative, compassionate, relaxed and extremely focused on customer service.
fits.dislikes: Rapid growth has lead to a more corporate feel.

fits.plan-process: We will have a planning meeting as a team and then we will communicate throughout the project who will take what ticket.
fits.office-layout: Open floor layout with assigned desks
fits.team-building: Bowling or a local baseball game; something local and fun that doesn't take up a ton of time.
fits.likes: Everyone is so welcoming and cares about getting to know each other. The people come first and that's very apparent. It's a high performance culture without being high stress.
fits.appeal: I was looking for a place where I could learn a lot and be supported in that learning. I was also looking for a place I wanted to be with people I wanted to be with for 40 hours a week.

fits.plan-process: Figure out the end product, then backwards plan from there.
fits.office-layout: Mostly remote, seniors have their own offices, new hires work together
fits.appeal: Opportunities to learn and grow as a front-end developer
